verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329><s%> Musician <S%H5329><s%> upon Sheminith, <S%H8067><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> Help, <S%H3467><s%> LORD; <S%H3068><s%> for the godly <S%H2623><s%> man ceases; <S%H1584><s%> for the faithful <S%H539><s%> fail <S%H6461><s%> from among the children <S%H1121><s%> of men. <S%H120><s%>

They speak <S%H1696><s%> vanity <S%H7723><s%> every <S%H376><s%> one <S%H376><s%> with his neighbor: <S%H7453><s%> with flattering <S%H2513><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%> and with a double heart <S%H3820><s%> do they speak. <S%H1696><s%>
The LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall cut <S%H3772><s%> off all <S%H3605><s%> flattering <S%H2513><s%> lips, <S%H8193><s%> and the tongue <S%H3956><s%> that speaks <S%H1696><s%> proud <S%H1419><s%> things:
Who <S%H834><s%> have said, <S%H559><s%> With our tongue <S%H3956><s%> will we prevail; <S%H1396><s%> our lips <S%H8193><s%> are our own: who <S%H4310><s%> is lord <S%H113><s%> over us?

For the oppression <S%H7701><s%> of the poor, <S%H6041><s%> for the sighing <S%H603><s%> of the needy, <S%H34><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> will I arise, <S%H6965><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> I will set <S%H7896><s%> him in safety <S%H3468><s%> from him that puffs <S%H6315><s%> at him.

The words <S%H565><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> are pure <S%H2889><s%> words: <S%H565><s%> as silver <S%H3701><s%> tried <S%H6884><s%> in a furnace <S%H5948><s%> of earth, <S%H776><s%> purified <S%H2212><s%> seven <S%H7659><s%> times.
You shall keep <S%H8104><s%> them, O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> you shall preserve <S%H5341><s%> them from this <S%H2098><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%> for ever. <S%H5769><s%>
The wicked <S%H7563><s%> walk <S%H1980><s%> on every <S%H5437><s%> side, <S%H5439><s%> when the vilest <S%H2149><s%> men <S%H1121><s%> <S%H120><s%> are exalted. <S%H7311><s%>
